story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a kind and gentle king who ruled over a prosperous kingdom. This king had a young son named Prince Caleb, who was beloved by all who knew him.

Prince Caleb was a curious and adventurous boy, always eager to explore the world around him and learn new things. He spent his days playing with his friends in the castle gardens, studying with his tutors, and helping his father govern the kingdom.

One night, as Prince Caleb lay in his bed, he looked out the window and saw a bright star shining in the sky. He felt a strong desire to go out and see the star up close, so he got out of bed and sneaked out of the castle.

Prince Caleb followed the star until he came to a small stable on the outskirts of town. There, he found a young mother and her baby, who was lying in a manger. The mother looked at Prince Caleb with kind eyes and said, "Welcome, Prince Caleb. I am Mary, and this is my son, Jesus. He is a very special baby, for he is the Son of God, come to earth to bring peace and love to all people."

Prince Caleb was amazed and humbled by this revelation, and he felt a deep sense of awe and reverence for the baby Jesus. He spent the rest of the night kneeling by the manger, praying and singing songs of praise.

As the dawn broke, Prince Caleb returned to the castle, his heart filled with joy and wonder. From that day on, he dedicated his life to serving Jesus and spreading His message of love and peace.

And so, Prince Caleb became a great leader, known for his wisdom, kindness, and devotion to God. He ruled his kingdom with justice and compassion, and his people loved him for it. And whenever he looked up at the stars in the night sky, he was reminded of that special night when he met the baby Jesus, and he gave thanks for the gift of His love.

The end.

Now, my dear son, it's time to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, knowing that you are loved and cherished by God and by me. Goodnight.
